name: Leaves and Lizards Arenal Volcano Cabin Retreat

reviews.text: Our hosts, Steve & Debbie, did a great job. Oscar, the GM and nature walk guide, was wonderful. The setting, and views from the Coco and (more so) Congo cabins were to die for. The food was above average. Dora, one of our hostesses and servers in the dining room in the morning was truly a gem. My 2 year old hit it off with her, and many of the other members of the staff.
reviews.title: This Place Isn't for Everyone...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Leo, a 3rd-party tour guide with whom they do business, particularly for the Canyo Negro boat and wildlife tour was maybe the best tour guide I've had on any continent - including his personality, likeability, incredible knowledge (both common and scientific), and mastery of English as his second language.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay, great tours

reviews.text: There are hundreds of commenters here who have, and will continue to extoll the virtues of this place - and you should take heed. I am giving this place the first "average" rating out of the hundreds of other comments because (a) it will not impact the overall incredibly high score, (b) we had some genuine complaints and difficulties, and (c) it just might get your attention.
reviews.title: Unique Experience!

reviews.text: MOST IMPORTANTLY, note that this is clearly a retreat, not a resort. Getting to and from cabins, dining room, reception, barn... requires you to have a rental car (we didn't), or to do a little hike in the hot and humid Costa Rican environment. Most of the time we didn't mind this a bit, but of course we needed to consider it those times and others. The hike is on a dirt road, but believe it or not, with many loose stones and grade/angle, was still challenging. We all turned an ankle at least once. If you're looking to be pampered, the Nayara Arenal was wonderful.
reviews.title: Secluded space with spectacular views

reviews.text: Our cabin had lots and lots of insects - all the time. They put a floral arrangement on the table in each room. I wish it had occurred to me on the first day, not the last, that the bugs really enjoyed this arrangement. There was a line of insects coming and going day and night. My wife needed to bring her laptop to do a little overflow work, sadly. She put it on the table, and later on the bench, it was full of little white mite looking insects (sugar ants, is how my stepmother, also on the trip, referred to them.) You're in nature, and they do not exterminate, so be prepared.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, Interesting place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 6 nights at this incredible place and cannot wait to return. After reading the glowing reviews, expectations were set very high... once we arrived, the reality surpassed all expectations. There is something about this place that cannot really be described in words... it is something that you feel once you are there. You are immersed natural, pristine beauty. I will never forget the first morning I woke up in the Volcano cabin and looked out the huge windows. The view was breathtaking ,it was one of those moments in time where you would not want to be anywhere else on earth. The photos you see online do not do it justice... it is something you have to experience. Besides the obvious incredible natural beauty, you are surrounded by warm people who really care about their guests. Steve and Debbie( owners) and all of their staff make you feel so welcome, as if you were a friend or family member coming to visit, not just a tourist.
reviews.title: Cannot be adequatley described in words... You must experience for yourself!!!!

reviews.text: One of the big reason's we chose L&L's was because of their horses and the rides they offer. My husband and I are horse people... we have horses at home and practically spend more time in the saddle than on the ground! The idea of riding in Costa Rica was a dream. We were not disappointed. The guides, who are also great horseman, took us on the rides of our life! We experienced a part of Costa Rican that that most visitors will never get to see… primary rainforest, rural villages and even a visit to a local dairy farm! The horses were wonderful ... My husband and I had the opportunity to ride their Costa Rican gaited “Criollo” horses. We were very impressed with these horses… they were incredibly sure footed, had amazing endurance and energy but were gentle and calm all at the same time. I was also very happy to see that Debbie (a horsewoman herself) is incredibly conscientious of the well being of her horses and has taken great measures to introduce “natural horsemanship” to the local community… she has done a tremendous job of improving the welfare of the horses in the area… she has several rescue horses that are in the process of being rehabilitated. They have also created a therapeutic riding program for local people with disabilities. This is the kind of people they are... they not only have a wonderful resort, but they also give back to the local community and the environment. It was refreshing to find a place where you know that your dollars are going to the right place...
reviews.title: We can confirm what others have said

reviews.text: Lastly, I cannot forget to mention the food… hands down the best we had in Costa Rica.
reviews.title: Leaves and Lizards exceeds expectations

reviews.text: We can’t say enough great things about L&L’s … there is something here for everybody. We cannot wait to return and do one of their treks on horseback!
reviews.title: Perfect
Great food, beautiful views
reviews.text: We just got back and had an incredible experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the airport and found L & L waiting for us. The drive took about 3 hours, but our driver was helpful and gave us time to practice our spanish.
reviews.title: Great place, great experience

reviews.text: Off a beaten path, L & L offers quaint and immaculately clean cabins with outstanding views of the Arenal Volcano. The hosts, Debbie and Steve, are generous, accommodating, and personable. The food is fantastic and changes nightly; if you want something a little lighter for dinner than a full entrée, homemade pizzas are available if ordered by the early afternoon.
reviews.title: A real gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first morning, we did the nature walk. Oscar is a very knowledgeable tour guide and presenter; try to take advantage of the free nature walk w/ him at 6:15 am.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Serene

reviews.text: We rented a car from Alamo and they were nice enough to pick us up. (it's a soild 20 minute ride from town.) We did rafting on the Balsa river the first day and this was great. After rafting, we ate a large meal on a 100 year old "Tico" farm and learned how sugar cane is made, w/out machinery.
reviews.title: Incredible Experience at Leaves and Lizards

reviews.text: The next day, we did the horseback riding to the water fall.Their horses are enjoyable for people of all ages and while riding through the area to the private waterfall, you will likely see Howler monkeys, sloths, poisonous dart frogs, toucans, and an array of other birds and plants
reviews.title: excellent retreat!

reviews.text: 6 months later we all agree our four nights there was a highlight of our three week stay in Costa Rica.
reviews.title: Surpasses all expectations- even after reading the reviews.

reviews.text: Our 11 yr old son loved gathering eggs and helping with the milking each morning.
reviews.title: Memories

reviews.text: Staff was heartwarming- genuine smiles always.
reviews.title: Best place to shoot a T.V. Pilot!

reviews.text: Nice paths on the property for an evening or morning stroll.
reviews.title: It really is beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Steve and Debbie run a top notch place, and put much into the community. Very accommodating, eat with the guests in the dining room, and I never found them to be anything but considerate to our every wish.
reviews.title: So wonderful

aka: Leaves And Lizards Arenal Volcano Cabin Retreat Hotel La Fortuna De San Carlos
description: This secluded resort is located on 26 acres with spectacular viewing of the Arenal Volcano near La Fortuna. Enjoy the panoramic vista of Arenal and Cerro Chato from a hammock on your porch or from your comfortable, orthopedic, queen sized beds with Egyptian cotton sheets. Meals prepared using locally grown ingredients at the Lava Lizard on-site dining facility. Guests are invited to help with daily 'chores' on this working farm. Milk a cow, collect eggs for breakfast or groom a horse. Enjoy private horseback riding, professional guide service, on site spa and 2 km of on site nature trails. The vision at Leaves and Lizards is to create the perfect blend of adventure, discovery and tranquility for each guest.
